newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-YANKEES TRADE DUNCAN TO BLUE JAYS.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-YANKEES TRADE DUNCAN TO BLUE JAYS.

text.p: The New York Yankees traded disgruntled infielder Mariano Duncan to the Toronto Blue Jays for minor league outfielder Angel Ramirez on Tuesday.
After the trade, the Yankees, who will also give Toronto money in the Duncan deal, purchased the contract of outfielder Pete Incaviglia from Triple-A Columbus to replace Duncan on the roster.
Duncan, a vital cog in New York's World Series run last year, became disenchanted in New York when his playing time was reduced this year and asked to be traded.
The Yankees sent Duncan and left-handed pitcher Kenny Rogers to San Diego on July 4th for slugger Greg Vaughn, but the trade was voided when Vaughn failed his physical.
Both Duncan and Rogers returned to New York after the All-Star break and Duncan repeated his desire to be traded.
